title: 112_hr5861
content: ELDERLY HOMELESS VETERANS HOUSING GRANT PILOT PROGRAM. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs and the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development will establish a pilot program to grant funds to nonprofit organizations for providing homeless veterans with non-transitional housing. Eligible organizations must be nonprofits assisting homeless veterans with housing, operating in different locations, and submitting an application to the Secretaries. The Secretaries may award two grants under this section, each not exceeding $25,000,000, to nonprofit organizations for purchasing and renovating real property to provide housing for up to 200 eligible homeless veterans. Eligible homeless veterans can receive housing if they have been continuously homeless for a year or more, or have had at least four separate periods of homelessness in the last three years. They must also have a condition that limits their ability to work or perform daily activities, such as a substance abuse disorder. Homeless veterans aged 55 or older with specific conditions can receive housing assistance. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must provide case management to ensure proper support, with a ratio of homeless veterans to caseworkers not exceeding 25 to 1. Non-profit organizations granted funds can also offer case management services. The Secretaries must report on the pilot grant program for homeless veterans, including the number of veterans served, types of services offered, money spent per veteran, program recommendation, and any other relevant information. Authorization of appropriations is also provided. Authorization of $50,000,000 in appropriations for the pilot grant program for homeless veterans. Definition of "homeless veteran" provided. Program terminates two years after grant award.
